p: The VPT used to evaluate the antimicrobial activity of the LEO vapour phase is shown in Table 5. After 24 h of incubation time, differing results emerged: For P. fluorescens, the MIC was higher than 40 µL whereas K. marina, E. coli, and B. cereus recorded an MIC of 20 µL. A. bohemicus recorded the lowest level, with an MIC of 2 µL. After seven days the plates were checked to evaluate the bactericidal and bacteriostatic activity. No differences were found in B. cereus and P. fluorescens compared with the previous check, recording an MBC of 20 µL and more than 40 µL, respectively; moreover in E. coli and K. marina, colonies were found in the 2 and 20 µL treatments while MBC was 40 µL. In A. bohemicus, the MBC was 20 µL.
